Name: Returns threads executing possibly injected code. This is determined by finding thread start function addresses not mapped to a file on disk.
Show PID/TID: By default is unchecked and will display [omitted] for both PID and TID. Check this box for both process and thread IDs to be displayed.
Show Omitted Results: By default believe false positives will be omitted from results. By checking this box you will see all possible false positive results.
Process: "full path of process. Will show mismatches when found between process and kernel paths"
PID: "Process ID when Show PID/TID is checked"
TID: "Thread ID when Show PID/TID is checked"
Header: "First 2 bytes of allocated memory region in hex"
Mapped File: "File mapped to this memory region or No Mapped File"
Memory Type: "Type of the pages in the memory region such as MEM_MAPPED or MEM_PRIVATE"
Allocated Protection: "Protection of the memory region when allocated such as PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE or PAGE_EXECUTE_WRITECOPY"
Page Protection: "Protection of the page in the memory region such as PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE or PAGE_EXECUTE_WRITECOPY"
Start Address: "The Win32 thread function start address"
Region Size: "The total size of the allocated memory region the Win32 thread function start address is in"
When no suspicious threads are found, "No injected threads found" is returned.

This sensor is used in many ways, including to find a common target for machines which may have responded to a question with a 'where' clause - get "online from machines where IP address starts with 192.168.10." will allow you to target the respondents with an action or count responses.

Name: Online Random Sample
Description: Sample your population. Return True for X % of online devices, False for 100-X% online devices. Can be used for targeting sample audiences, such as Tagging for phased roll-out or sampled analysis of index logs

Name: Open Port
Description: Returns the ports which are listening on a local machine and the IP address the port is bound to. 0.0.0.0 indicates that the port is bound to all IP addresses.

Name: Open Ports
Description: Returns the top 1000 (according to Nmap) open tcp ports. Example: 135,443,445,902,912,1536,1537,1538,1539,1566

Name: Open Share Details
Description: Returns a set of columns with details about open shares on a machine.

Name: Example: name | path | status | type | permissions
Open Share Inventory Status
Description: The status of the Open Share Inventory package used to collect details of shares on endpoints.

Name: The Status column shows general Completed or Failed results.
If the action had a failure, the Status Reason column might contain information of what failure occurred.
If Run Time returns a negative number:
-1 = The inventory status file has an invalid WhenStarted date
-2 = The inventory status file has an invalid WhenCompleted date
-3 = Determining the action runtime resulted in an invalid negative value
Open Shares
Description: Returns information about shares on a PC.

Name: Operating System
Description: Returns the name of the Operating System from all machines. This name may be localized.

Name: Operating System Boot Directory
Description: Returns the directory the Operating System boots from.

Name: Operating System Build Number
Description: Returns the build number of the installed operating system.

Name: Operating System Edition
Description: Returns the edition of the installed operating system.

Name: Operating System Full Build Number
Description: Returns the Build Number, and UBR.

Name: Operating System Generation
Description: Returns the generation of the Operating System from all machines.

Name: Examples: Windows 10, Windows Server 2008 R2, Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server 6, Mac OS X 10.14
Operating System Install Date
Description: Returns the date the OS was installed.

Name: Operating System Language
Description: Returns the OS language along with any Language Packs installed.

Name: Operating System Language Code
Description: Returns the Language Code (LCID) of the Operating System. This differs from the Locale Code returned in the Locale Code sensor.

Name: Operating System SKU
Description: Returns the Operating System SKU value.

Name: Operating System Temp Directory
Description: Returns the gobal temp directory of the Operating System.

Name: Organization
Description: Returns the Organization defined at OS install time.

Name: Original Filename
Description: Gathers the original filename for that binary on disk. This is a potential indicator that someone has renamed a legitimate binary. For example, copying and renaming the cmd.exe binary to a different location in an attempt to avoid detection

Name: OS Boot Time
Description: Returns the Date and Time that the OS last booted in UTC.

Name: OS Platform
Description: Returns the platform of the operating system. Example: Windows

Name: Out of Date Antivirus Benchmark Metric
Description: Out of Date Antivirus Data

Name: Outlook Version
Description: Returns the version of Microsoft Office Outlook installed.

Name: Packet Loss
Description: Returns data about percent of packet loss on Windows machines.

Name: Page File Details
Description: Returns information about the Page File(s) on a Windows system. Path, initial size, maximum size, size on disk, current used, and peak used.

Name: Example: C:\pagefile.sys|3050 MB|3050 MB|3050 MB|413 MB|517 MB
Parentless Processes
Description: Returns any running processes that do not have a parent process, or top level processes.

Name: Patch - Applicable Patch Count
Description: Returns the count of all applicable patches.

Name: Patch - Applicable Patches by Year
Description: Returns a row for every applicable patch on an endpoint

Name: Example: MSXML 6.0 RTM Security Update (925673)|Critical|4/4/2012|KB925673|False|Windows|Windows Server 2012 R2|Security Updates
Patch - Block Lists
Description: Returns the enforcement status for Block Lists

Name: Patch - Coverage Status
Description: Returns "Optimal" if Patch is installed and running, "Needs Attention" if Patch is not installed or is not healthy, "Unsupported" if the operating system is not supported, and Initializing if the system is in the process of installing tools or running the first scan.

Name: Patch - Coverage Status Details
Description: Returns "Optimal" if Patch is installed and running, "Needs Attention" if Patch is not installed or is not healthy, "Unsupported" if the operating system is not supported, and Initializing if the system is in the process of installing tools or running the first scan. Provides additional details for systems have a "Needs Attention" status to help administrators resolve client health issues.

Name: Patch - Deployment Errors
Description: Returns error messages for Deployments defined in the Patch Workbench

Name: Patch - Deployment Results
Description: Returns the deployment results for deployments defined in the Patch Workbench

Name: Deployment Id|Patch UID|Patch Title|Result|Severity|Release Date|KB Articles
Patch - Deployment Statuses
Description: Returns the deployment statuses for deployments defined in the Patch Workbench

Name: Patch - Direct Download Statuses
Description: Returns download statuses for endpoints that download update files from the internet

Name: Patch - Enforcement Status
Description: Returns the enforcement status for Blacklists and Scan Configurations defined in the Patch Workbench

Name: Patch - Has Aged Applicable Patches
Description: Returns a Yes/No answer for the question of whether the system has applicable patches that meet the specified Patch Age and Severity parameters.

Name: Patch - Has Antivirus Compatibility Registry Key
Description: Returns Yes or No if the QualityCompat registry setting that informs future patches that antivirus software was updated is set.

Name: Patch - Has Enforced Maintenance Window
Description: Returns Yes or No if a maintenance window policy is enforced on the endpoint.

Name: Patch - Has Enforced Scan Configuration
Description: Returns Yes or No if a scan configuration is being enforced.

Name: Patch - Has Recent Scan Results
Description: Returns a Yes/No answer for the question of whether the system has Patch scan results within the specified Scan Age Days.

Name: Patch - In Maintenance Window
Description: Returns "Yes" for an active maintenance window, "No" if outside of all maintenance windows, or "No Maintenance Windows Enforced" if the endpoint has no maintenance windows

Name: Patch - Incompatible Configurations
Description: Returns all incompatible configurations from ECF

Name: Patch - Installation State
Description: Returns a row for every applicable patch on an endpoint, and indicates whether it's installed or required.

Name: Example: a5aa3417baf0e1e0672dd70abacee6ea|MSXML 6.0 RTM Security Update (925673)|Not Installed|True|Critical|4/4/2012|MS06-061|1853208|07609d43-d518-4e77-856e-d1b316d1b8a8|KB925673|CVE-2006-4686 CVE-2006-4685|http://www.download.windowsupdate.com/msdownload/update/v3-19990518/cabpool/msxml6-kb925673-enu-amd64_cc347d98b9fe1e417cb73f0ddf004d1f94a4bfcf.exe|msxml6-kb925673-enu-amd64_cc347d98b9fe1e417cb73f0ddf004d1f94a4bfcf.exe|False|Windows|Windows Server 2012 R2|Security Updates
Patch - Is Process Running
Description: Is the Patch process running on this endpoint? Example: Yes

Name: Patch - Last Scan Duration
Description: Returns the last scan duration rounded up to the nearest 30 seconds

Name: Patch - Maintenance Windows
Description: Returns the enforcement status for Maintenance Windows

Name: Patch - Mean Time to Patch
Description: Returns Mean Time to Patch from an endpoint

Name: Patch - Offline CAB Build Date
Description: The sensor returns the "Date" for the "index.xml" file inside the wsusscn2.cab ("CAB") file. Generally, the timestamp for the "index.xml" file is the day prior to "Patch Tuesday." This sensor is only applicable if the Offline CAB scan type is configured & deployed.

Name: Patch - Offline CAB Days Old
Description: The sensor returns the "Days Old" for the "index.xml" file inside the wsusscn2.cab ("CAB") file. Generally, the timestamp for the "index.xml" file is the day prior to "Patch Tuesday." This sensor is only applicable if the Offline CAB scan type is configured & deployed. "Days Old" provides the a numeric response of the days between the CAB file timestamp and the current date.

Name: Patch - Patch Downloads
Description: Returns the status for Tanium file downloads initiated by Patch deployments.

Name: Patch - Patch List Applicability
Description: Returns a row for every unique patch showing the lists that it matches

Name: Patch - Patch List Applicability Results
Description: Returns a row for every unique patch showing the lists that it matches

Name: Patch - Patch List Compliance
Description: Returns endpoint compliance with respect to each Patch List defined. Example:

Name: Patch - Patch Process Options
Description: Returns the values of all Patch Process Options (returns the default value if no override is configured)

Name: Patch - Repositories
Description: Returns repository information for repositories defined and enabled on the endpoint

Name: Patch - Repository Variables
Description: Returns repository variables key:value pairs with corresponding operating system from an endpoint

Name: Patch - Requires Patch 1 Cleanup
Description: Returns Yes if a running TaniumPatch.vbs process is detected or if a Tanium Client\Tools\PatchMgmt directory is present.

Name: Patch - Requires WSP Cleanup
Description: Returns Yes or No if the systems has files leftover from Windows Security Patch that need to be cleaned up

Name: Patch - Scan Age
Description: Returns the number of days since the last scan.

Name: Patch - Scan Configurations
Description: Returns the enforcement status for Scan Configurations

Name: Patch - Scan Errors
Description: Returns error messages for Scan Configurations defined in the Patch Workbench

Name: Patch - Self Service Activity
Description: Return the self service activity for deployments

Name: Patch - Self Service Deployments
Description: Return Patch self service deployments

Name: Patch - Supported Scan Types
Description: Returns the supported package scan types for the endpoint.

Name: Patch - Tanium Scan Product Applicability
Description: Returns a list of applicable Windows products as found by Tanium Scan.

Name: Patch Installation History
Description: Returns a list of patches that were installed along with the date and the tool that installed them (AV Definition updates and Windows Store updates are excluded)

Name: Patch Installation History - Linux
Description: Returns a list of patches that were installed along with the date and the package manager that installed them

Name: Path Permissions
Description: Returns the permissions of the given file or folder path

Name: PCI Device
Description: Returns the names of PCI devices in the system.

Name: Example:Intel(R) 82371AB/EB PCI Bus Master IDE Controller
Performance - Active Profile
Description: Returns the id of the active profile or "None" if there is no active profile, as well as the revision of the profile.

Name: Performance - Affected Disks
Description: Returns affected disks for disk events that occurred in a given duration for a given category. Categories: 'Disk Capacity', 'Disk Latency'

Name: Performance - Application Crashes
Description: Returns application crashes including process, crash count and version over the specified duration.

Name: Performance - Application Details Metric Analysis
Description: Will return the utilization of a given metric over a certain time for the processes that make up an application.

Name: Performance - Application Health Data
Description: Returns the average daily CPU and Memory Utilization as well as the daily Application Crash count for configuration Applications.

Name: Performance - Application Metric Analysis
Description: Will return the utilization of an application (as defined by the processes in the parameter of this sensor).

Name: Performance - Boot Metrics
Description: Boot metrics that include count, average, maximum, and minimum values in seconds over a specified duration.

Name: Performance - Configured
Description: Returns the endpoint configured state in regards to Performance. Return value examples: "Not Configured", "Configured", "Unsupported". If Not Configured, the endpoint will return why it is not configured. Return value examples: "Needs Tools", "Needs Profile".

Name: Performance - Coverage Status
Description: Returns the Performance coverage status. Return value examples: "Optimal", "Needs Attention", "Unsupported". See Performance - Configured sensor for reasons why the endpoint needs attention.

Name: Performance - Daily Stream Stats
Description: This sensor is used to collect the statistics recorded for Stream. The results are reported as a RFC 3339 date and the total bytes transferred for that date. The bytes transferred are grouped into the following buckets: "0 B", "<= 10 MB", "<= 50 MB", "<= 100 MB", "<= 200 MB", "<= 1 GB", "1 GB+". Note that this sensor will return the sum of bytes sent by all streams on the endpoint.

Name: Performance - Endpoint Score
Description: The Performance Score is determined by a weighted average of the scores per event type to compute an overall health score for a single endpoint within the last 24 hours. Each profile can have its own weights.

Name: Performance - Endpoint Score Details
Description: The Performance Score is determined by a weighted average of the scores per event type to compute an overall health score for a single endpoint within the last 24 hours. Each profile can have its own weights.

Name: Performance - Endpoint Score Details with Health
Performance - Event Category Match Count
Description: Returns the count of events that occurred in a give duration for a given category. Categories: 'cpu', 'mem', 'disklat', 'diskcap', 'appcrash', 'syscrash', 'netlat', 'netoutage', 'wifisignal', 'boottime', 'logontime', '*'(all categories). 'ex. Event Category Match Count['24h', 'mem']

Name: Performance - Event Category Match Counts
Description: Returns bucketed counts of events for a category ID in a give duration.

Name: Performance - Event Details
Description: Returns detailed information about Performance events occurring within a specified timeframe for a specific event category.

Name: Performance - Event Match Counts
Description: Returns bucketed event count on Endpoint grouped by event type in a given duration.

Name: Performance - Installed Profiles
Description: Returns a list of profile ids

Name: Performance - Last Boot
Description: Details about the last boot. Includes duration in seconds and date. Health is determined based on duration.

Name: Performance - Last Logon
Description: Details about the last logon. Includes duration in seconds and date. Health is determined based on duration.

Name: Performance - Logon Metrics
Description: Logon metrics that include count, average, maximum, and minimum values in seconds over a specified duration.

Name: Performance - Process Metric Analysis
Description: Performs a specified analysis (e.g. Avg) of a given process name, for a specific metric, over a certain number of hours.

Name: Performance - Profile Versions
Description: Returns the status ("Installed", "None Installed"), the profile id and the revision

Name: Performance - Startup Programs Count
Description: Return the number of programs configured to run on startup on the endpoint

Name: Performance - System CPU Queue Length Metric Analysis
Description: Performs a specified analysis (e.g. Avg) of the CPU Queue Length metric over a certain number of hours.

Name: Performance - System CPU Utilization Analysis
Description: Performs a specified analysis (e.g. Avg) of a specific CPU metric over a certain number of hours.

Name: Performance - System Crashes
Description: Returns system crashes including bug check references over the specified duration.

Name: Performance - System Disk Metric Analysis
Description: Performs a specified analysis (e.g. Avg) of a specific Disk metric over a certain number of hours.

Name: Performance - System Memory Metric Analysis
Description: Performs a specified analysis (e.g. Avg) of a specific Memory metric over a certain number of hours. Results are in bytes for most metrics. "Memory Utilization" is a percentage of total memory.

Name: Performance - System Network Metric Analysis
Description: Performs a specified analysis (e.g. Avg) of a specific Network metric over a certain number of hours.

Name: Performance - Top Process Metric Analysis
Description: Returns the top x processes for a specified analysis (e.g. Avg), for a specific metric, over a certain number of hours.

Name: Performance - Top Processes
Description: Returns top process for events within the duration specified. This means more than one can be returned but only one per event.

Name: Performance - Trends Application Metric Analysis
Description: Will return the utilization of a particular computer resource from UTC midnight until machine's current UTC time for a given application. This application is defined by a list of processes provided by the user. Currently supported are CPU normalized (total, user, and kernel) and Memory

Name: Performance - Trends Event Category Match Counts
Description: Returns bucketed counts of events for a category name since UTC midnight.

Name: Performance - Trends Event Summary
Description: Returns Performance Event Summary for the past day.

Name: With Critical Events or Without Critical Events
Performance - Trends Process Metric Analysis
Description: Will return the utilization of a particular computer resource from UTC midnight until machine's current UTC time for a given application. This application is defined by a list of processes provided by the user. Currently supported are CPU normalized (total, user, and kernel) and Memory

Name: Performance - Trends System Metric Analysis
Description: Will return the utilization of a particular computer resource from UTC midnight until machine's current UTC time. Currently supported are CPU (total, user, and kernel) and Memory

Name: Performance - Trends Top Application Crashes
Description: Returns up to the top x applications that have crashed the most from UTC midnight until machine's current UTC time

Name: Performance - Trends Top Process Metric Analysis
Description: Returns up to the top x processes for a specified analysis (e.g. Avg), for a specific metric, from UTC midnight until machine's current UTC time

Name: Performance - Trends Top System Crashes
Description: Returns up to the top x bugcheck codes that have occurred the most from UTC midnight to current time.

Name: Performance - TSDB Status
Description: Returns information about the Tanium TSDB process on endpoints - version, space consumed, etc.

Name: Performance - Zombie Counts
Description: Returns the most recent count of zombie processes and when it was collected (bucketed within 5m intervals). This count is collected every 4h and is capped at 1000.

Name: Physical Disk
Description: Physical disks installed on the endpoint

Name: Physical Disk Type
Description: Physical disks installed on the endpoint and their type

Name: Physical Volumes
Description: Returns the logical volume names on the endpoint.

Name: Pod Availability
Description: Reports the pod availability.

Name: Pod Details
Description: Reports the pod details.

Name: Pods Running inside Cluster
Description: Reports the pods running inside a cluster.

Name: Power Plans Active
Description: Returns the currently active power plan.

Name: Power Plans Available
Description: Returns the available power plans.

Name: PowerForensics File Record
Description: Retrieves the Master File Table (MFT) modified, accessed, changed, and born times for a specified file name. Returns file name, STANDARD_INFORMATION (SI) time stamps, and FILE_NAME (FN) time stamps. All time stamps are returned in UTC format.

Name: PowerForensics Master Boot Record
Description: Retrieves the operating system name, enumerated through WMI, and the MD5 hash of the master boot record (MBR) code section.

Name: PowerForensics Prefetch
Description: Searches prefetch entries for previously executed applications with a provided file path.

Name: PowerForensics Recently Opened Office Files by User
Description: Returns the path of any recently opened Office files by User name (required) and file path (optional). Requires PowerShell 2.0 or later.

Name: PowerForensics Shim Cache
Description: Retrieves executables that might have been run from entries in the Microsoft Application Compatibility section of the Registry. If an Explorer window is opened to a location for a given executable, a shim cache entry might be created even if the executable was never run.

Name: PowerForensics UserAssist Search
Description: Parses a specified NTUser.dat file for a user account. Returns the list of applications that were recently run in the Windows GUI. If an optional executable name is specified, only entries matching that executable are returned.

Name: PowerShell Effective Execution Policy
Description: The effective execution policy for the PowerShell session. PowerShell determines the effective execution policy by evaluating execution policies set by Set-ExecutionPolicy and Group Policy settings.

Name: PowerShell Logging Configuration
Description: Reports the applied activity logging policy configurations for PowerShell and PowerShell Core.

Name: The following configuration items are reported:
If Transcription is enabled, the Additional Data column will list the defined OutputDirectory.
If Module Logging is enabled, the Additional Data column will list what modules are defined for monitoring.
This data can be useful to determine what logging configurations are applied to endpoints.
Use this information to enable standardizing PowerShell and PowerShell Core logging across your enterprise.
Context - Where the configuration data was read. System = HKLM registry. Tanium = The user context of the Tanium Client process.
Target - Indicates where the configuration setting applies (PowerShell or PowerShell Core).
Component - The logging configuration item being reported.
Status - The status of the configuration item (Enabled, Disabled, Not Configured).
Additional Data - May contain two data points.
1- The path where transcription data is written.
2- What modules are configured for logging.
PowerShell Scope Policies
Description: The execution policies for each scope in the order of precedence as set by Set-ExecutionPolicy and Group Policy settings.

Name: PowerShell Version
Description: Returns the version(s) of PowerShell installed on a system

Name: Predicted Disk Failures
Description: Returns drives and the S.M.A.R.T. status of the drives on machines which have a failing drive reporting through S.M.A.R.T.

Name: Primary Owner Name
Description: Returns the name of the Primary System Owner on Windows. This is set at OS install time.

Name: Primary WINS Server
Description: Returns the primary WINS server of a machine.

Name: Printers
Description: Returns printers connected to a system.

Name: Process Count
Description: Parameter: Name of a process

Name: This sensor will return the number of times that process occurs. Leave blank for a count of all processes.
Process Details
Description: Returns verbose details about running processes

Name: Processes Using Module
Description: Lists processes that use a specified module.

Name: Provider ID
Description: The unique identifier scoped to within the Provider Type. Provider Type and Provider ID form a uniquely identifying Provider pair.

Name: Provider Name
Description: For user configured providers, the name configured for this provider.

Name: Provider Type
Description: The specific type of the entity reporting this sensor. For example, this might be "Tanium Client" or "Apple NDM".

Name: PST Information
Description: Returns details of PST files that have been mounted by users on a system.

Name: Quarantined Sensors
Description: List of sensors that have been quarantined on the local endpoint.

Name: RAM
Description: Returns the amount of RAM available to the operating system, in Megabytes.

Name: RAM Max Capacity
Description: Returns the size of the maximum amount of RAM a machine can carry.

Name: Ram Slots Unused
Description: Returns the number of empty, unused RAM slots.

Name: RAM Slots Used and Unused
Description: Returns the number of used and unused RAM slots.

Name: Random Group Threshold
Description: This sensor will output a random number from 0-99 used as a threshold for group membership.

Name: RDP Client History
Description: Returns Local Profile, RDP Target Name or IP, and Remote Logon Name for a remote desktop client. Note that if an attacker starts the RDP client with the /Public option, then this information is not recorded in the user profile registry hive.

Name: Reboot Required
Description: Returns data indicating that a reboot is required and, if so, for which reason.

Name: Recently Closed Connections
Description: Returns any recently closed connection, ie those connection currently in CLOSED_WAIT or TIME_WAIT. If the process that owned the connection can be determined, it will be included.

Name: Recorder - Amazon Linux Version
Description: Returns the version of Amazon Linux installed, e.g. 2

Name: Recorder - Extension Settings
Description: Show Recorder Settings which have been set via Package.

Name: Recorder - Is BPF BCC Supported
Description: Returns 'True' if BPF BCC is supported on this endpoint

Name: Recorder - Is BPF CO-RE Supported
Description: Returns 'True' if BPF CO-RE (Compile Once Run Everywhere) is supported on this endpoint

Name: Recorder - Is BPF Supported Details
Description: Returns details about if BPF is supported on this endpoint

Name: Recorder - Is Extension Enabled
Description: Returns Disabled if the recorder extension is not loaded, and is disabled by the client setting DisableExtension_recorder.

Name: Recorder - Legacy Installed
Description: Returns 'Yes' if legacy version of Tanium Recorder is installed, otherwise 'No'

Name: Recorder - Red Hat Enterprise Linux Version
Description: Returns the version of Red Hat Enterprise Linux installed, e.g. 8.3

Name: Recorder - Suse Linux Version
Description: Returns the version of SuSe Linux installed, e.g. 12.1

Name: Recorder - Ubuntu Linux Version
Description: Returns the version of Ubuntu Linux installed, e.g. 18.04

Name: Redirection Trust Mitigation Events
Description: Returns Redirection Trust Mitigation Events

Name: Registry Key Exists
Description: Returns True if the Registry Key exists, False if not. If HKEY_USERS is the given hive, it will loop through each logged in user's registry hive. HKEY_CURRENT_USER will also loop through all logged in user hives. HKLM, HKU, and HKCU are valid shorthand.

Name: Registry Key Subkeys
Description: Returns all subkeys of a supplied key. If HKEY_USERS is the given hive, it will loop through each logged in user's registry hive and attempt to output the user's name. HKEY_CURRENT_USER will also loop through all logged in user hives. HKLM, HKU, and HKCU are valid shorthand.

Name: Example: N/A | Tanium Client | 32-bit | HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client
Registry Key Value Exists
Description: Returns True if the Registry Value exists, False if not. If HKEY_USERS is the given hive, it will loop through each logged in user's registry hive. HKEY_CURRENT_USER will also loop through all logged in user hives. HKLM, HKU, and HKCU are valid shorthand.

Name: Registry Key Value Names
Description: Returns all values contained in a supplied key. If HKEY_USERS is the given hive, it will loop through each logged in user's registry hive and attempt to output the user's name. HKEY_CURRENT_USER will also loop through all logged in user hives. HKLM, HKU, and HKCU are valid shorthand.

Name: Registry Key Value Names with Data
Description: Returns the data and values in a supplied registry key. If HKEY_USERS is the given hive, it will loop through each logged in user's registry hive and attempt to output the user's name. HKEY_CURRENT_USER will also loop through all logged in user hives. HKLM, HKU, and HKCU are valid shorthand.

Name: Registry Value Data
Description: Returns the data of a supplied value in a supplied registry key. If HKEY_USERS is the given hive, it will loop through each logged in user's registry hive and attempt to output the user's name. HKEY_CURRENT_USER will also loop through all logged in user hives. HKLM, HKU, and HKCU are valid shorthand.

Name: Remote Desktop Event Log Search
Description: Retrieves the most recent RDP events from the Terminal Services event log. Requires Tanium Client 6.0.314.1420 or later.

Name: Reveal - Index File Count
Description: Returns count of index files that match one or more supplied inputs

Name: Reveal - Index File Details
Description: Returns details of index files that match one or more supplied inputs

Name: Reveal - Index File Exists
Description: Returns Yes or No, using Index to determine whether the specified file exists based on the supplied input

Name: Reveal - Index File Hash Recently Changed
Description: Returns details of index files that match one or more supplied inputs

Name: Reveal - Index Has Category Hit
Description: Returns Yes/No for endpoints with files matching a Category

Name: Reveal - Index Has No Validation Rule Hit
Description: Returns Yes/No for endpoints with files matching a rule with no validation

Name: Reveal - Index Has Rule Hit
Description: Returns Yes/No for endpoints with files matching a rule

Name: Reveal - Index Has Valid Rule Hit
Description: Returns Yes/No for endpoints with files matching a rule

Name: Reveal - Index Installed Rules
Description: Returns Rule IDs installed on the endpoint

Name: Reveal - Index Is Path Indexed
Description: Evaluates index configuration to see if a path will be indexed

Name: Reveal - Index List Discovered Volumes
Description: Returns list of filesystem volumes discovered by index

Name: Reveal - Index No Validation Rule Hit Files
Description: Returns files that match rules with a no validation

Name: Reveal - Index Quick Search
Description: Search for a hashed token on an endpoint.

Name: Reveal - Index Rule Hit Files
Description: Returns files that match rules

Name: Reveal - Index Rule Hit Files by Validation
Description: Returns files that match rules with a validation

Name: Reveal - Index Rule Hit Summary
Description: Summary of rule hits

Name: Reveal - Index Tuning - Get Top Extensions
Description: Returns the top 10 file extensions with highest file counts (bucketed) for tuning index

Name: Reveal - Index Tuning - Get Top Paths
Description: Returns the top 10 paths with highest file counts (bucketed) for tuning index

Name: Reveal - Index Valid Rule Hit Files
Description: Returns files that match rules with a valid validation

Name: Revision of CPU
Description: Returns the revision number of installed CPUs.

Name: Risk - Vector Base Score
Description: Returns the base risk score components as key value pairs for a vector domain and name.

Name: Risk Coverage
Description: Provides status for the ability to calculate each vector for an endpoint.

Name: Risk Vectors
Description: Provides the endpoint risk score, vectors scores, endpoint criticality, and other details at the endpoint level.

Name: RPM Database Details
Description: Returns data about a Linux machine's RPM database in key/value format.

Name: RPM Database Locks
Description: Returns the count of RPM database lock files under the /var/lib/rpm directory.

Name: RTAC Artifacts
Description: Returns an artifact.json blob if an RTAC job has finished

Name: Run Command History
Description: Lists the commands that were run from the Windows command prompt field on the Start menu.

Name: Run Keys
Description: Returns the run keys that define which programs will be started when a user logs in.

Name: Run Level
Description: Returns the set run level of Linux systems

Name: Run Once Keys
Description: Returns the run once keys that define which programs will be started when a user logs in.

Name: Running Applications
Description: Provides a list of applications that are running at the present time on the client machine.

Name: Running Container Data
Description: Reports running container data.

Name: Running Container Details
Description: Reports the running container details.

Name: Running Containers
Description: Identifies all running containers, including those hidden and unknown to the orchestration layer (such as System or Rogue containers).

Name: Running Instances of Image
Description: Reports the running instances of image.

Name: Running Processes
Description: Provides a list of processes currently running on the client machine.

Name: Running Processes Memory Usage
Description: Returns all running processes along with the memory each process uses. This is the process's working set.

Name: Running Processes Of User
Description: Provides a list of the currently running processes associated with the specified user.

Name: Running Processes With Filename Mismatch
Description: Gathers running processes and inspects the original filename for that binary on disk. If the running process and the binary original filename are different, results will be returned. This is a potential indicator that someone has renamed a legitimate binary. For example, copying and renaming the cmd.exe binary to a different location in an attempt to avoid detection

Name: Running Processes with Hash
Description: Lists the fully-qualified path and hash of each running executable.

Name: Running Processes with MD5 Hash
Description: Lists the fully-qualified path and MD5 hash of each running executable file.

Name: Running Processes With Parent
Description: Provides a list of the processes currently running and the parent process of the process.

Name: Running Processes With User

Name: Video Graphics Card RAM
Description: Amount of RAM in the video card in the client machine.

Name: Video/Graphics Card
Description: Description of the video card in the client machine.

Name: Virtual Platform
Description: Returns the virtual platform or technology used for the virtual machine, if it is a virtual machine.

Name: Visual Studio Code Extensions
Description: Returns installed Visual Studio Code Extensions for endpoints with VS Code. Returns user folder name, extension ID, extension UUID, extension path, version, publisher, and if package.json for the extension is found on disk.

Name: VMware Guest
Description: Returns True if client machine is a guest VM in VMware.

Name: Volume Group Names
Description: Display Volume Group Names

Name: Windows 11 Compatibility
Description: Used to determine if the endpoint is capable of running Windows 11. Returns "Compatible" or "Not compatible", and "FAIL" for failed hardware checks.

Name: Windows Audit Policy
Description: Retrieves the Windows Audit Policy; Trace records the operating system audit data typically seen in the Windows Security Event Log. This policy can be altered. However, if Group Policy is set, it might overwrite the log.

Name: Windows Automatic Update Status
Description: Determines if Automatic Updates are enabled or not and returns the result

Name: Windows BAM Entries
Description: Returns Windows Background Activity Moderator (BAM) program file path entries from the endpoint. Available on Win 10 or later only.

Name: Windows Component State
Description: Reports the state of Windows Capabilities, Optional Features, and Server Features.

Name: Windows Credential Security Settings
Description: Returns the results of 10 Windows configuration settings that affect security.

Name: Windows Detailed BAM Entries
Description: Returns Windows Background Activity Moderator (BAM) program file path entries from the endpoint. Available on Win 10 or later only. Includes user SID and Last Execution Timestamp in UTC.

Name: Windows ESU License Status
Description: Reports the Extended Security Update (ESU) licensing status.

Name: Windows Features
Description: Returns the currently installed and enabled Windows Features on a Windows 7 or later system.

Name: Windows Operating System Activation Status
Description: The activation status of the installed Windows operating system.

Name: Windows OS Major Version
Description: Returns the Windows OS Major Version.

Name: Windows OS Release ID
Description: Returns the Windows OS Release ID.

Name: Windows OS Type
Description: Will output "Windows Server" or "Windows Workstation" depending on the OS type.

Name: Windows RMM Application BAM Entries
Description: Tanium Guardian RMM Spotlight: Returns the process name and product display name for a select list of RMMs using entries found in the Windows Background Activity Moderator (BAM) data. This is indicative of historical execution and can contain typically a weeks' worth of data.

Name: Windows Security Center Registered Antivirus Software
Description: List antivirus software registered with the Windows Security Center along with their current status.

Name: Windows Server Installed Roles
Description: Returns the currently installed roles on a Windows Server.

Name: Windows Update Agent - KB5039302 KB5040442 - Impacted Endpoints
Description: Detects if an endpoint is impacted by an issue with KB5039302 and KB5040442

Name: Windows Update Agent Version
Description: The version of the Windows Update Agent on the client machine.

Name: Wireless Network Connected SSID
Description: Returns the SSID (name) of the wireless network(s) a machine is connected to.

Name: Wireless Network Details
Description: Details of currently active wireless network connection by client machine: SSID, MAC address, connection state, network type, radio type, authentication, receive rate, transmit rate, and signal strength from 0 (minimum) to 5 (maximum).

Name: Example: hotspotwifi | xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx | connected | infrastructure | 802.11g | wpa2-personal | 54 Mbps | 54 Mbps | 4
Wireless Network SSID Strength
Description: Returns the SSID name and signal strength of a connected wireless network from 0 (minimum) to 5 (maximum).

Name: Wireless Network Used by Tanium
Description: Returns the SSID name, the IP Address, and the Signal Strength of connected wireless networks only if the Tanium Client is using those networks to communicate.

Name: Wireless Networks Using WEP
Description: Details of currently active wireless network connection using WEP authentication by client machine. Details include SSID, MAC address, connection state, network type, radio type, authentication, receive rate, transmit rate, and signal strength (0-5).

Name: Example: hotspotwifi | xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx | connected | Infrastructure | 802.11g | WEP | 54 | 54 | 5
Wireless Networks Visible
Description: Returns details of all wireless networks a machine can see, whether they are connected or not. Details include SSID, Network Type, Authentication Method, and Encryption Level all in lowercase.

Name: WMI Event Consumers
Description: Lists Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) event consumers. Returns script path for ActiveScriptEventConsumers and command for CommandLineEventConsumers.

Name: Workgroup
Description: The configured workgroup for each Windows machine not joined to a domain.

Name: WSUS Server
Description: Returns the configured value for WSUS Server and WSUS Status server, if any. Returns 'Not Configured' if values do not exist.

Name: x64/x86?
Description: Returns whether the client machine is 64-bit or 32-bit (x86).

Name: This sensor is deprecated with the advent of a newer CPU Architectures.
The "CPU Architecture" sensor should be used for architecture-specific targeting.
